intro: Miquelia courtallensis, commonly known as the Indian cherry or Malabar cherry, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of southern Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible and often used in traditional cuisines. It thrives in humid climates and is often found in forested areas, contributing to local biodiversity.
